Hello, Chessnut Fans!
Greetings from the Chessnut team! 😘 We're here to provide you with more information about Chessnut Evo.
♟️ As some of you may know, our previous chessboard, Chessnut Air, was powered by the renowned open-source AI chess engine called Stockfish. While Stockfish proved to be a reliable engine, we have taken Chessnut Evo to the next level by incorporating significant enhancements. 🚀😎
♟️What truly sets Chessnut Evo apart is its cutting-edge Maia Chess engine.🔥 Maia is widely recognized as the most popular neural network chess engine in the world, and it's known for its incredible human-like qualities. With Maia, your chess games will reach new heights of sophistication and skill.🌟
Maia has been specifically designed to replicate the playing style and decision-making of human players. By utilizing advanced algorithms and machine learning techniques, it thoroughly analyzes the chessboard and strategically evaluates every move.💡This approach aims to provide a more realistic and challenging opponent for players.
Want to learn more about MAIA? Just visit 👉 https://maiachess.com/
​​Get ready to enhance your chess experience and unleash your full potential with Chessnut Evo!🔥🔥
Best regards,
Chessnut Team

The chess fan 🏟️ would learn a lot by trying to solve 2 movers (+ other chess problems) from the diagram and therefore train his/her mind's eye.  It is excellent training and the chess fan would learn many wonderful chess ideas that benefit his/her play (George has found solving chess problems a wonderful and pleasant hobby).

Chess Puzzles: 🧩 Keeps your mind sharp.

¿Estás de acuerdo con las palabras de #NigelShort? | Hoy cumple 58 años uno de los mejores jugadores ingleses de la historia del ajedrez. Tres veces campeón británico y mejor conocido por clasificarse para desafiar a Garry Kasparov por el campeonato mundial en 1993. Después de que Short se clasificara a través de la FIDE, ambos jugadores se separaron de la organización para jugar su match, que ganó Kasparov.

Short se convirtió en MI en 1980 a la edad de solo 14 años. Aunque ahora es una edad en la que varios jugadores han hecho no solo MI sino GM , en ese momento probablemente era el MI más joven de la historia. ( Es posible que Bobby Fischer y Henrique Mecking hayan llegado antes, pero no se dispone de registros irrefutables).

Hasta la fecha, Short sigue siendo el único ajedrecista inglés en ganar un torneo de candidatos por el título indiscutible. Solo otros dos, y solo uno nacido en Inglaterra, han jugado en algún campeonato mundial desde 1886. Johannes Zukertort, quien se mudó a Londres en 1872 y moriría y sería enterrado allí, jugó contra Wilhelm Steinitz en 1886. El otro es Michael Adams, quien fue subcampeón en el Campeonato Mundial de 2004 de la FIDE. Adams, que ganó siete Campeonatos Británicos de Ajedrez, es uno de los pocos jugadores además de Short (Howard Staunton sería otro) que tiene un caso como el mejor ajedrecista británico de todos los tiempos.

Be you. Make your move. 

In chess, each piece has a name and a role. Whether the King, Queen, Knight, Bishop, Rook, or Pawn, all pieces working together is what helps a skilled chess player win the game. Daily living is a lot like this; many pieces to the game of life work together to allow you to be authentically who you are from dusk until dawn. 

If you know the rules of chess, you know that each piece can only move in specific directions. Have you ever felt like this? When you know what you need and even how to get there, but the moves necessary to accomplish the goals set for yourself are not a direct route?  You adapt, readjust, and overcome. 

As you move about your day today, be deliberate with each step as you move in all directions. Be cognizant if your surroundings and how all of life’s other players impact your game. This is your life and you make the rules by simply being you.

The New York Times series Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported, has chosen to highlight Sultan Khan. This unassuming man from a small town in Punjab, from a family of landowners and pirs, went on to become a chess champion the world respected and rivals feared. He first became the All-India Chess Champion in 1928, and then won the British Chess Championship in 1929, 1932 and 1933. During a whirlwind period of four years, he competed against the world’s best chess players and more than held his own. He went back to India in 1933, and never played another chess match again. 

If you want to know more about this remarkable man, his grandchildren are said to be currently writing a book about him!

少しF1の話を。
先週はモナコGP。そして、今週はスペインGP。

世界各国を飛び回るF1サーカスですが、今はヨーロッパ圏での連戦中です。

今シーズン、好調なのはGP連覇中の王者フェルスタッペンと元世界王者のアロンソ。

アロンソは、現在41歳。
通常は引退していてもおかしくない年齢のドライバーですが、今シーズンはドライバーズランキング3位につける好成績をおさめています。

節制やトレーニングでコンディションを維持しているのでしょうが、同じくらいの年齢のグルマン店主から見ると本当に凄いなと思います。

反射神経や運動能力は年齢と共に落ちてきてしまうのは必然で、そこを何でカバーするかをよく理解しているからこそ出来る現在の成績。
ベテランと呼ばれる年代の選手のアドバンテージを最大限に発揮して連覇中の王者に挑む姿は、見ていて胸が熱くなります。

今週のアロンソは自身の母国でのGP。
10年振りの母国での勝利を期待しつつ、今日もカレーを作ります！
